London Business School
:::
2025â€“

Yale University, GSAS
:::
2024â€“2025
:::
Key modules
Graduate Measure Theory and Probability (A+), Functional Analysis ::: ::: {.cv-card} ::: {.cv-head} ::: {.cv-left}
MSc Econometrics & Mathematical Economics (EME)
London School of Economics
:::
2023â€“2024
:::
Key modules
Econometric Analysis (Top 5%), Advanced Macroeconomics, Advanced Microeconmics, Contracts and Organization ::: ::: {.cv-card} ::: {.cv-head} ::: {.cv-left}
MSc Economics
University of Warwick
:::
2022â€“2023
:::
Key modules
Microeconomic Theory (Top 1%), PhD Stochastic Calculus, Game Theory, Monetary Economcis (Top 1%) ::: ::: {.cv-card} ::: {.cv-head} ::: {.cv-left}
BSc Economics
University of Warwick
:::
2019â€“2022
:::
Key modules
Microeconomics, Macroeconomics, Econometrics, Advanced Time Series Econometrics (Top 1%) Mathematical Economics, Real Analysis III, Metric Spaces and Toplogy, Mathematical Methods, Mathematical Statistics, Stochastic Processes, Decision Theory, . ::: ## Research Experience ::: {.cv-card} ::: {.cv-head} ::: {.cv-left}
Pre-Doctoral Research Fellow, Yale University
Tobin Center for Economic Policy and Economic Growth Center
:::
June 2024â€“ Sept 2025
:::
Advisors: Professors Samuel Kortum, Nicholas Ryan
- For Samuel Kortum: - Optimal Unilateral Carbon policies; - Gains from trade in a structural change model with climate shocks to agriculture. - For Nicholas Ryan: - Scraped over 2000 PDFs to build a dataset on energy firm's cost quotations to join the energy grid. - Reduced form regressions to feed into the model CCPs and CTPs. - Estimating a dynamic game for firms joining the California energy grid (CAISO).
Papers worked on
- [Firm-to-Firm Trade: Imports, Exports, and the Labor Market](https://bpb-us-w2.wpmucdn.com/campuspress.yale.edu/dist/c/4257/files/2023/10/EM_10192023.pdf) *(Econometrica, 2025).* - [Optimal Unilateral Carbon Policy](https://bpb-us-w2.wpmucdn.com/campuspress.yale.edu/dist/c/4257/files/2024/12/Optimal_Unilateral_Carbon_Policy__Direct-66.pdf) - Agriculture and Gains from Trade. ::: ::: {.cv-card} ::: {.cv-head} ::: {.cv-left}
Research Assistant, University College London
Centre for Time Use Research
:::
Nov 2023 â€“ June2024
:::
Advisors: Professor Jonathan Gershuny, Dr Juana Lamote de Grignon Perez
- In a research project funded by the International Labor Organization, Investigated the underestimation of child labour in survey questionnaire vs time use diaries in Low Middle Income Countries. - Identified, collected, and harmonised over 300 surveys to construct the [Multinational Time Use Survey](https://www.timeuse.org/mtus). ::: ::: {.cv-card} ::: {.cv-head} ::: {.cv-left}
Research Assistant, University of Warwick
Microeconmic Theory - Competition and Regulation
:::
Jan 2023 - June 2023
:::
Advisor: Professor Daniele Condorelli
Papers worked on
- [Fair-share payments for Network Investments](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.infoecopol.2025.101127) *(Information Economics, 2025).* - [Data-Driven Envelopment with Privacy-Policy Tying ](https://doi.org/10.1093/ej/uead090) *(The Economic Journal, 2024).* ::: ::: {.cv-card} ::: {.cv-head} ::: {.cv-left}
Research Assistant, University of Warwick
Labor Economics
:::
June 2022 - Nov 2022
:::
Advisor: Professor Jennifer Smith
- Project: Investigating individual labour market flows and transitions using BHPS and UKHLS panel data 1980-2020. - Created new datasets from BHPS/UKHLS. - Conducted sequence analysis using SQ/SADI package in STATA. - Investigated labour market flows with optimal matching and clustering analysis. ::: ## Methods & Programming Python, R, Stata, LaTeX (advanced); MATLAB, Dynare (intermediate); ArcGIS (beginner) ## Teaching ::: {.cv-card} ::: {.cv-head} ::: {.cv-left}
Online Tutor
:::
August 2023 - Nov 2023
::: - Undergraduate- Economics. - A level- Economics, Mathematics, Further Mathematics, Further Statistics. ::: ## Awards ::: {.cv-card} ::: {.cv-head} ::: {.cv-left}
Pioneer Award, University of Warwick
:::
2022
Exceptional Volunteer, Warwick Volunteers,
2021
::: - Awarded for Outstanding commitment to the local community. ::: ## Languages English (IELTS: 8.5/9, C2), Hindi (Native), Telugu (Proficient), Sanskrit (Intermediate) ## Citizenship ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡³ Indian --- Print as PDF
